results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology, including reflexive thematic analysis (RTA) and scientometric analysis. (Section 2.1, 2.2)
The document provides a step-by-step description of the study design, including survey distribution, data analysis (RTA coding process), and scientometric analysis methods. (Sections 2.1, 2.2)
The document states that the datasets are available on the Open Science Framework (OSF). (Last paragraph)
Data is shared, so justification for not sharing is not applicable.
The document mentions the availability of the thematic analysis and associated memos, and the VOSviewer JSON files, which serve as data documentation. (Last paragraph)
Data collection methods are fully described, including the survey instrument (23-item survey), participant recruitment, and response rate. (Section 2.1)
The document states that the datasets include VOSviewer JSON files, implying the use of VOSviewer software and its associated data. (Last paragraph)
Code is shared, so justification for not sharing is not applicable.
While data is shared, the code used for data preparation (e.g., survey data cleaning, coding) is not explicitly mentioned as being shared.
The scientometric analysis is described, including the use of DOI searches and network visualization software (VOSviewer). (Section 2.2)
While the scientometric analysis is described, effect sizes, confidence intervals, and p-values are not reported.
The document provides subjective context and interpretation of the qualitative data, particularly in the discussion of the CoP values and the thematic analysis. (Sections 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6)
The data coding and analysis process (RTA) is clearly described, including the use of five codes grounded in the CoP values. (Section 2.1, 3.2)
The results of both the qualitative and quantitative analyses are clearly presented, with illustrative examples and tables. (Sections 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6, 3.7)
The document discusses limitations, including potential recall bias and the response rate, and acknowledges potential biases related to the sample. (Section 5.3)
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
